<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">

    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/107396</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>107396</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770205399</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">By Hand: Gary Stevens</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Eigenhändig: Gary Stevens</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">À la main : Gary Stevens</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Por Mão: Gary Stevens</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">A mano: Gary Stevens</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Με το χέρι: Θ*Γαρυ Stevens</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">A mano: Gary Stevens</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">SPARK follows sculptor Gary Stevens through his creative process, from harvesting unusual pieces of wood from ancient redwood forests through the painstaking work that produces his uniquely beautiful wood vessels. This Educator Guide is about the history and tradition of wood carving.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Arts</string>
          </keyword>
          <coverage>
            <string language="en">North America</string>
          </coverage>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">FUNKEN folgt Sculptor Gary Stevens durch seinen 
kreativen Prozeß, vom Ernten der ungewöhnlichen Stücke Holzes von 
den alten Rotholzwäldern durch die sorgfältige Arbeit, die seine 
eindeutig schönen hölzernen Behälter produziert. Diese 
Erzieher-Anleitung ist über die Geschichte und die Tradition des 
hölzernen Schnitzens.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">L'ÉTINCELLE suit le sculpteur Gary Stevens par 
son processus créateur, de moissonner les morceaux peu communs de 
bois des forêts antiques de séquoia par le travail soigneux qui 
produit ses navires en bois seulement beaux. Ce guide 
d'éducateur est au sujet de l'histoire et de la tradition du 
découpage du bois.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">A FAÍSCA segue o sculptor Gary Stevens com seu 
processo creativo, de colher partes incomuns de madeira das florestas 
antigas do redwood através do trabalho painstaking que produz suas 
embarcações de madeira excepcionalmente bonitas. Esta guia do 
educador é sobre o history e a tradição de carving de madeira.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">La SCINTILLA segue lo scultore Gary Stevens con il
suo processo creativo, dalla raccolta delle parti insolite di legno 
dalle foreste antiche del redwood attraverso il lavoro scrupoloso che 
produce i suoi vasi di legno unicamente bei. Questa guida 
dell'educatore è circa la storia e la tradizione di scultura del 
legno.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ο ΣΠΙΝΘΗΡΑΣ ακολουθεί το γλύπτη Gary Stevens μέσω
της δημιουργικής διαδικασίας του, από τη συγκομιδή των 
ασυνήθιστων κομματιών του ξύλου από τα αρχαία δάση redwood 
μέσω της προσεκτικής εργασίας που παράγει τα μεμονωμένα όμορφα 
ξύλινα σκάφη του. Αυτός ο οδηγός εκπαιδευτικών είναι για 
την ιστορία και την παράδοση ξύλινης γλυπτικής.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">La CHISPA sigue a escultor Gary Stevens con su 
proceso creativo, de cosechar pedazos inusuales de madera de bosques 
antiguos de la secoya a través del trabajo cuidadoso que produce sus 
recipientes de madera únicamente hermosos. Esta guía del 
educador está sobre la historia y la tradición de tallar de madera.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Künste</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Arts</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Artes</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Arti</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Τέχνες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Artes</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770205399</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
          <contribute>

          </contribute>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="x-t-cc-url">http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/</string>

          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>

  </manifestation>
